members.member:
Finds articles containing disease reports that match the given criteria.
API Usage Information:
Sample request:
GET /GetArticles?start_date=2016-01-01T00:00:00&end_date=2021-01-01T00:00:00&key_terms=Listeria&location=Arizona
Sample response:
[ { "url":"https://www.cdc.gov/listeria/outbreaks/enoki-mushrooms-03-20/index.html", "reports":[ { "diseases":[ "listeriosis" ], "syndromes":[ "Encephalitis" ], "event_date": "2016-11-23 xx:xx:xx to 2019-12-13 xx:xx:xx", "locations": [ { "country": "United States", "location": "Arizona", "geonames_id": 5551752 }, ... { "country": "United States", "location": "Virginia", "geonames_id": 6254928 } ] } ], "headline":"Enoki Mushrooms - Listeria Infections", "main_text":"36 people infected with the outbreak strain of Listeria monocytogenes have been reported from 17 states. Illnesses started on dates ranging from November 23, 2016 to December 13, 2019...", "date_of_publication":"2020-03-01 17:40:00" } ]
The beginning of the date range to be searched. All articles returned will have a report whose event date (or date range) is later than or equal to this date.
Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss
Example: 2019-12-25T17:00:00
Example: 2020-01-26T12:00:00
The end of the date range to be searched. All articles returned will have a report whose event date (or date range) is earlier than or equal to this date.
Format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss
Example: 2020-04-25T20:00:00
Example: 2020-02-19T10:00:00
The timezone associated with the given start and end date. Must be an unambiguous timezone abbreviation or timezone name from this list.
Example: Central Standard Time
Example: AEDT
List of key terms to search for in a comma-separated string. All articles returned will match at least one of the given terms. Leave blank to retrieve all articles matching other specified criteria.
Example: Listeria,Salmonella
Example: Virus,Outbreak
The name of the location to search for. All articles returned will contain a report that references either the specified location or a sub-location within the specified location.
Example: Arizona
Example: United States
The maximum number of matching articles to be returned (maximum: 50). If the number of matching articles is greater than max, the first max of those articles will be returned.
The number of matching articles to skip.
Explanation: Suppose max is 3, and the matching articles are numbered 0 through to 9. If offset is 0 or not specified, articles 0, 1 and 2 will be returned. If offset is 3, articles 3, 4 and 5 will be returned. If offset is 9, only article 9 will be returned.
Successful query Invalid input parameters Internal server error

member.name: T:MedicApi.Swashbuckle.SwaggerExampleValue
member.summary: A custom attribute for setting default parameter values in Swagger. Decorate the desired API endpoint '[SwaggerExampleValue(name, value)]'.

member.name: T:MedicApi.Swashbuckle.AddExampleValues
member.summary: A Swashbuckle filter that applies the default values. Add 'c.OperationFilter/' to AddSwaggerGen in Startup
